articles.title: Friendship Meeting with Cuban Embassy Officials Held
articles.content:
Friendship Meeting with Cuban Embassy Officials Held
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- The International Affairs Department of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea hosted a New Year friendship meeting with staff members of the Cuban embassy here at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel on Friday.
					 Present there on invitation were Ambassador Jose Manuel Galego Montano and staff members of the embassy.
					
					  Secretary Kim Yong Il and other officials of the International Affairs Department of the WPK Central Committee were on hand. 
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					 The participants talked to each other about the need to boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the parties and peoples of the DPRK and Cuba.
					
					 Prior to it, they watched Korean documentary film "Reply of Korea".

articles.title: DFRK Committee Appeals to All Koreans
articles.content:
DFRK Committee Appeals to All Koreans 
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea issued an appeal to all the Korean people Friday. 
					 The appeal said that it was fortunate, indeed, that the danger of war in which fire was returned for fire last year was defused temporarily thanks to the DPRK's positive efforts but this danger still persists.
					
					 Endless outbursts inciting confrontation with the other side are heard from the south and ceaseless north-targeted saber-rattling is going on there, the appeal noted, and continued:
					
					  Dialogue and negotiations are the only way for averting a war, defusing confrontation and improving the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 What is essential in the inter-Korean dialogue is dialogue between the authorities with real power and responsibility. A lot of important matters related to the vital interests between the north and the south await solutions and most of them should be settled by the authorities. 
					
					Environment for dialogue and negotiations has already been created and their doors remain open to them to sit at a negotiating table to have a candid discussion.
					
					 There is no reason for the south Korean authorities to refuse to respond to the DPRK's proposal for wide-ranging dialogue.
					
					 We appeal to the south Korean authorities to discard useless misgivings and prejudice and honestly come out for all the proposed north-south dialogues without delay and any condition.
					
					 We courteously call upon the politicians in the north and the south to actively conduct bilateral and multilateral negotiations to fulfill their mission and duty before the times and the nation. 
					
					 We propose contact and negotiations between lawmakers of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the National Assembly of south Korea to settle the grave situation prevailing between the north and the south and seek the way for the nation to follow. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should not block but actively encourage free visit, contact and cooperation between personages of various circles of the north and the south including politicians, businessmen, religionists and media persons.
					
					 All the Koreans in the north and the south and overseas should turn out to resolutely frustrate the moves of the warlike forces at home and abroad to ignite a war, a threat to the security and peace of the nation.
					
					 The U.S. is chiefly to blame for the present tragedy of the Korean nation.
					
					 If the U.S. government truly stands for peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula, it should not instigate the south Korean authorities to escalate confrontation but refrain from acts of deepening the mistrust between the north and the south and increasing the danger of war on the peninsula.
					
					 It is necessary to vehemently repudiate the evermore undisguised military nexus among south Korea, the U.S. and Japan and shatter the moves of the Japanese militarists to stage a comeback to Korea.
					
					 We call upon all the countries concerned and the peace-loving people of the world to pay deep attention to the situation on the peninsula and extend unreserved support to the joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK and the positive measures taken to put it into practice.

articles.title: Gift from Chinese
articles.content:
Gift from Chinese
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the director of the Beijing Association for International Friendly Contact on the occasion of his birthday.
					 The gift was conveyed to Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, by Jin Xiaofei, director of the Association, on January 25.

articles.title: New Core of Welding Rod Developed
articles.content:
New Core of Welding Rod Developed 
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- New type welding rods are widely used in the construction sites in the DPRK. 
					 They are popular among builders as their cores are made of new substance which does not produce harmful gas when working and meets the needs of all technical indexes and characteristic values. 
					
					 The materials used for making their cores are stronger than effervescing steel in terms of various values including tensile strength, elongation percentage and impact value. They fully ensure the mechanical strength of welded structure in welded part test and the test of nonmetallic substance left there. 
					
					 The establishment of the process for the production of the above-said materials for the cores of welding rods led to cutting down the cost for producing welding rods 75 percent as compared with that in the past. 
					
					 The above-said technology is successfully introduced to the Pyongyang Steel Works, the Pyongyang Elevator Factory and other factories.

articles.title: New Kind of Insulating Lagging Materials in Wide Use
articles.content:
New Kind of Insulating Lagging Materials in Wide Use
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- The information science research group of the Korean Rason Taehung Trading Company developed a new kind of heat radiation insulating lagging materials. They are regarded as economically profitable.
					 These lagging materials are being used by institutions and enterprises in Pyongyang and Rason cities and various local areas and rural villages.
					
					 Marlstone is their main raw material. 
					
					 Neither power nor equipment, except for additives, is required for producing those materials.
					
					 If institutions and enterprises introduce the lagging materials to their boilers and furnaces, they can lift the burning rate 97 percent while cutting down the coal consumption 30 percent as compared with that in the past.
					
					 If households in the countryside update firebox structures by use of those lagging materials, they can use peat as fuel for heating and cooking and produce quality compost. 
					
					 The new kind of lagging materials is environmentally friendly as it helps reduce the emission of carbon monoxide.

articles.title: Animal Feats Attract Visitors
articles.content:
Animal Feats Attract Visitors
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- There is an animal circus house in the Central Zoo here that draws visitors.
					 Pet dogs do sums, cross a single log bridge and take a slide to the delight of visitors.
					
					 Monkeys present movements requiring high technique including balancing on piled chairs, spinning of diverse tools and putting on flying hats.
					
					 They are "famous acrobats" admired by visitors. 
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il recently visited the Zoo and watched their feats and gave precious instructions to it.

articles.title: Northeast Asia Changes in Military Structure
articles.content:
Northeast Asia Changes in Military Structure 
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- Northeast Asia is undergoing a change in the military structure.
					 From the beginning of the new century the United States has concentrated its effort on gaining control of the region where it has vital interest.
					
					 As part of the effort, the United States has bolstered its military presence in the region. It has invested 12.6 billion dollars in the expansion of its Guam military establishment, the largest-ever investment in military installations in the western Pacific region since the end of the Second World War.
					
					 The United States has tightened up military alliance with Japan and south Korea, reinforcing its forces in the region. Many U.S. battleships, including nuclear-powered aircraft carrier, and nuclear attack means have been deployed on the Korean peninsula and its vicinity.
					
					 Japan has already made public a "mid-term program for defense capabilities adjustment" envisaging an investment of 276 billion dollars in the military in five years, a sign that Japan's defense capabilities will be boosted sharply.
					
					 South Korea and Japan are also seeking military cooperation.
					
					 The defense ministers of south Korea and Japan held talks on January 10 and agreed to have regular consultations for a military agreement and push ahead with the conclusion of agreements on supply of military equipment and comprehensive security of military information. If the two sides have the agreements, they will be able to share military information and closely cooperate in supply of fuel, food and other war materials.
					
					 Some countries' moves to cope with the U.S.-Japan-south Korea military tieup draw public attention.
					
					 Russia plans to stage largest-ever military exercises in the Far East in 2011 and boost its military existence in the region. 
					
					 In recent years China has been equipped with latest-type arms to increase its military capabilities.  
					
					 The change in the military structure of Northeast Asia is widely viewed as a sign of another cold war.

articles.title: S. Korea Should Opt for Dialogue with DPRK -- Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
S. Korea Should Opt for Dialogue with DPRK -- Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- The authorities of south Korea should take the stand to settle issue at a negotiating table, clearing away the doubt about their fellow countrymen in the north as soon as possible, said Rodong Sinmun Friday in a by-lined article. It said:
					 South Korea has made nonsense about the DPRK, doubting its proposal for dialogue. This is not proper approach to the dialogue.
					
					 To distrust the dialogue partner for no reason bedevils the north-south relations and will only stoke bitterer mistrust, driving the relations to a catastrophe. Now is the time to cut off this chain of evil cycle.
					
					 A key to solution lies in dispelling the useless doubt about the dialogue partner and resuming north-south dialogue at an early date. This dialogue would help remove misunderstanding, promote understanding and pave the way for peace, stability, reconciliation and unity.
					
					Putting up conditionality with doubt would never help settle the issue. If the north and the south discuss issues at the negotiating table with broad mind, they can understand sincerity of the other party and clear away doubts. To approach the dialogue from wrong stand would never help repair the north-south ties. It is certain that the homogeneous Korean nation with 5,000 years of history would dispel misunderstanding that lasted only decades.

articles.title: Reunification Is Essential for Korean Nation -- Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Reunification Is Essential for Korean Nation -- Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- The top priority task for the Korean nation at present is to reunify the country, said Rodong Sinmun Friday in a bylined article. It continued:
					 It is an urgent task of the Korean nation to achieve the reconciliation and unity between the north and the south and pave the way for reunification and prosperity.
					
					 Wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations would provide conditions for turning the north-south relations of distrust and confrontation into those of reconciliation and unity and independently solving the nation's problem. If the north and the south prioritize the reunification, the nation's vital demand, and hold dialogue and negotiations, it would be possible to defuse the tension and create atmosphere favorable for the reunification and prosperity through confidence-building and understanding between the two sides.
					
					 The dialogue should discuss important matters including those of repairing the damaged north-south ties and independently carving out the destiny of the nation by pooling its efforts.
					
					 There are many important matters pending negotiated settlement between the north and the south. The north-south authorities' talks should be held at an early date to solve such serious issues. If authorities with responsibility and real power sit face to face, it would be possible to dispel misunderstanding and distrust and frankly discuss the ways for peace on the Korean Peninsula and prosperity common to the nation.
					
					 Today is more important than yesterday and tomorrow is more valuable than today in attaining the great goal of the nation.
					
					 Whoever is concerned about the destiny of the nation should turn out to achieve national reconciliation and unity, irrespective of abode, affiliation, political view and religious belief, letting bygones be bygones.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Irresistible Trend of Times
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Irresistible Trend of Times
Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- Popular masses are heading for independence. This reflects the common desire and hope of humankind to live and develop free from aggression, war, domination and subjugation. No force on earth can stem this trend of the times. Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined article. 
					 It says:
					
					  If the popular masses are to build a new independent world and achieve progress and prosperity, they should put an end to aggression, war, domination and subjugation. 
					
					 The imperialists are the main target of the struggle. The people desirous of independence should see through the imperialists' hegemonic nature and methods and hold high the banner of struggle against imperialism. 
					
					 Their hegemonic nature and ambition can never change.
					
					 The imperialists are desperately working to establish domination over the world, taking advantage of the equilibrium that has been upset on the international arena. They are running the whole gamut of means and methods including military aggression, sanctions and pressure to achieve their hegemonic goals. 
					
					 Unity leads to victory while split leads to defeat. Aware of this truth, the world progressive countries are striving to boost their unity. Many countries in Asia, Africa and Latin America are working hard to achieve regional progress and integration by their concerted efforts. 
					
					 This proves their will to settle regional issues by their concerted efforts, protect the interests of the countries and nations and accelerate the building of  independent prosperous new societies and a new world.

articles.title: Release of Rev. Han Sang Ryol Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Release of Rev. Han Sang Ryol Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification demanded the authorities release Rev. Han Sang Ryol, a pro-reunification champion.
					 The organization in a commentary on January 23 recalled that the Seoul Central District Court sentenced him to five years in prison and five-year suspension of qualifications.
					
					 It was very just that Rev. Han visited the north with warm compatriotic feelings and ardent desire for reunification, the commentary said.
					
					 It is an anti-reunification act that the authorities sentenced him to heavy penalty on charges of violation of the "National Security Law", an unprecedented fascist law, it added.
					
					 It urged the present regime to release Rev. Han and immediately respond to the north's sincere and important proposal for dialogue and negotiations.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop Confrontation Policy
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop Confrontation Policy
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Koreans in the U.S. demanded the south Korean authorities stop at once the anachronistic confrontation policy against the June 15 era of independent reunification.
					 In a commentary on Jan. 21 the organization said that the Seoul Central District Court sentenced Rev. Han Sang Ryol, a pro-reunification champion, to five years in prison and five-year suspension of qualifications. The court also convicted Han Chung Mok, co-representative of the Solidarity for Progress, Jong Tae Yon, former chairman of its Policy Committee, and Choe Yong Ok, vice-chairperson of its Independent Reunification Committee, the commentary said, adding:
					
					 In order to remove the tension prevailing on the Korean Peninsula, the north and the south of Korea should sit face to face and search the way for independent and peaceful reunification.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should not antagonize the north but join hands with it for reunification.
					
					 The organization in a commentary on Jan. 20 voiced the expectation that the north-south high-level military talks would be held successfully, contributing to the improved north-south relations and peace.

articles.title: Inclusion of Korean Schools in Tuition Waiver Program Urged
articles.content:
Inclusion of Korean Schools in Tuition Waiver Program Urged
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- Japanese citizens and Korean residents in Japan are continuing their solidarity struggle demanding the inclusion of Korean schools in Japan in tuition waiver program.
					 The Network Aichi Demanding the Application of Tuition-free Program to Korean Schools called an emergency meeting in Nagoya City on Jan. 15.
					
					 Speakers at the meeting charged that the Japanese prime minister stopped the procedure for applying the program to Korean schools. This is evidently a discriminative act and a violation of human rights, they said.
					
					 They urged the Japanese government to include the Korean schools in the program as soon as possible.
					
					 The meeting adopted a request calling for the immediate application of the program to the Korean schools.
					
					 Students of Aichi Korean Senior High School conducted information activities that day.
					
					 The Okayama International Exchange Centre gave a lecture on the inclusion of Korean schools in the tuition waiver program on Jan. 19.
					
					 The participants expressed wrath at the national discrimination by the Japanese government, declaring that they will fight it out for inclusion of Korean schools in the program.
					
					  Then they adopted a written request to the prime minister, the chief Cabinet secretary and the minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan.

articles.title: Celebrations of Kim Jong Il's Birthday Held Abroad
articles.content:
Celebrations of Kim Jong Il's Birthday Held Abroad
Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- Events were held in different countries on January 14 and 18 to celebrate February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They included a meeting, photo exhibition and film show in Sweden and an opening ceremony of the Korean handicraft exhibition and film shows in Russia.
					
					 Displayed in their venues were photos on immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and photos and handicrafts showing the true picture of Songun Korea.
					
					 Korean films shown included "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "The Arch of Triumph".
					
					 The chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association said that the DPRK under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il encourages the world progressives in their struggle as a powerful and stable socialist state and a fortress of independence and peace against imperialism.
					
					 We extend full support to the Korean people in the efforts to improve the people's living standard, defuse the tension in the Korean Peninsula and Northeast Asia and bring earlier the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, he said.
					
					 The director of the Bureau for Culture of the Ryazan Regional Administration of Russia said that the exhibits would help visitors know better about the reality of the DPRK and the indomitable will of the Korean people dynamically advancing toward the future, closely rallied around their leader.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting in Sweden.

articles.title: Birthday of Kim Jong Il Observed in Ethiopia
articles.content:
Birthday of Kim Jong Il Observed in Ethiopia
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea released the 19th issue of its bulletin on January 22 to mark February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The bulletin in an article said that Kim Jong Il translates into reality the long-cherished desire of the people to lead an affluent and civilized life in an independent and powerful country, helping and leading each other forward with nothing to envy in the world.
					
					 The Korean people deem it their highest honor and greatest happiness to be led by Kim Jong Il, the bulletin said, elaborating on his undying feats for the country and the people.

articles.title: French to Observe DPRK Anniversaries
articles.content:
French to Observe DPRK Anniversaries
Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- A French preparatory committee was formed in Paris on Monday to commemorate the Day of the Sun, the birthday of President Kim Il Sung, and February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The committee elected Andre Aubry, delegate president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, to be its chairman.
					
					 It decided to hold colorful political and cultural events, including a meeting, lecture, seminar, film show and photo exhibition, in the period from February to April.

articles.title: Encuentro de amistad con miembros de embajada cubana
articles.content:
Encuentro de amistad con miembros de embajada cubana 
  Pyongyang, 28 de enero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del Ano Nuevo, el Departamento Internacional del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea organizo el dia 28 en el Hotel Coryo de Pyongyang el encuentro de amistad con los miembros de la Embajada de la Republica de Cuba acreditada en Corea.
					  Fueron invitados a la ocasion el embajador Jose Manuel Galego Montano y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica.
					
					  Tambien estuvieron presentes Kim Yong Il, secretario del CC del PTC y otros funcionarios del citado Departamento.
					
					  Hubo discursos en el acto.
					
					 Los participantes estrecharon el sentimiento de amistad departiendo sobre el problema de desarrollar tambien en el ano en curso las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los partidos y los pueblos de ambos paises.
					
					 Con anterioridad, ellos vieron el documental coreano "Respuesta de Corea".

articles.title: FDRP publica llamamiento a la nacion coreana
articles.content:
FDRP publica llamamiento a la nacion coreana
  Pyongyang, 28 de enero (ATCC) -- El Comite Central del Frente Democratico para la Reunificacion de la Patria (FDRP) hizo publico el dia 28 un llamamiento a toda la nacion coreana.
					  Afortunadamente, la crisis de guerra, que llegaba al extremo en el ano pasado, se vio remediada temporalmente gracias a los esfuerzos activos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea,  pero, esto no significa la erradicacion de ella, senala el documento y prosigue:
					
					  En el Sur de Corea se escuchan de continuo las palabras conflictivas que provocan a la contraparte y se libran incesantemente las maniobras belicas contra el Norte.
					
					  El dialogo y las negociaciones son unico remedio para prevenir la guerra, eliminar la confrontacion y resolver las relaciones Norte-Sur.
					
					  Lo principal en el dialogo intercoreano es las conversaciones entre las autoridades que tengan el poder real y la responsabilidad.
					
					  Ahora, entre el Norte y el Sur estan pendientes de solucion muchos problemas importantes relacionados con el destino de la nacion y la mayor parte de ellos deben ser resueltos por las autoridades.
					
					  Ya esta preparada la mesa de dialogo y negociaciones y abierto el corazon para discutir sinceramente.
					
					  Las autoridades surcoreanas no tienen ningun motivo de no aceptar la propuesta de amplio dialogo de la RPDC.
					
					  El FDRP exhorta a las autoridades surcoreanas que acudan ahora mismo incondicional y sinceramente a todas las conversaciones con el Norte propuestas ya dejando el escepticismo y el prejuicio  innecesarios.
					
					  Llama cortesmente a los politicos del Norte y el Sur que sostengan las negociaciones bilaterales y multilaterales para cumplir la mision y el deber que asumen ante la epoca y la nacion.
					
					  Propone sostener el contacto y negociaciones entre los diputados a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC y los parlamentarios de la Asamblea Nacional del Sur de Corea para superar la grave situacion dada entre ambas partes coreanas y buscar en conjunto el camino a seguir por la nacion.
					
					  Las autoridades surcoreanas no deben impedir el libre viaje reciproco, contacto y cooperacion entre distintos sectores y capas, tales como politicos, funcionarios economicos, religiosos y publicistas, sino promoverlos activamente.
					
					  Toda la nacion coreana del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar debe frustrar rotundamente las maquinaciones de las fuerzas belicas internas y externas que amenazan la seguridad y la paz de la nacion.
					
					  EE.UU. es el autor que impuso a la nacion coreana la tragedia de hoy.
					
					  Si el gobierno estadounidense desea de veras la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana, no debe incitar a las autoridades surcoreanas a la confrontacion ni agravar la desconfianza entre ambas partes coreanas y el peligro de guerra en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					  Es imperioso rechazar la confabulacion militar tripartita Sur de Corea-EE.UU.-Japon que se torna cada dia mas abierta y frustrar las maniobras de los militaristas japoneses enrumbadas a la nueva agresion.
					
					  El FDRP exhorta a todos los paises interesados y los pueblos del mundo amantes d la paz que presten atencion profunda a la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y envien el desinteresado apoyo y respaldo a la reciente declaracion conjunta del gobierno, los partidos politicos y las entidades de la RPDC y a las medidas para ponerla en practica.

articles.title: Se cambia estructura militar del Nordeste Asiatico
articles.content:
Se cambia estructura militar del Nordeste Asiatico
 Pyongyang, 28 de enero (ATCC) -- Se va cambiando la estructura militar de la region del Nordeste Asiatico.
					  En el nuevo siglo, Estados Unidos concentra la mayor parte de sus fuerzas en tomar la hegemonia sobre esa region vital para sus intereses.
					
					  En ese sentido, consolida primero su presencia militar en la region.
					
					  Por ejemplo, amplia las instalaciones militares en la isla Guam invirtiendo 12 mil 600 millones de US$. Esta suma significa la maxima inversion en la construccion de establecimientos militares de EE.UU. en la region del Pacifico Oeste despues de terminada la Segunda Guerra Mundial.
					
					  Particularmente, el imperio consolida la alianza militar bilateral con Japon y el Sur de Corea y la trilateral con estos y emplaza mucho mas efectivos en las areas perifericas.
					
					Efectivamente, estan desplegados ahora los buques de combate de gran tamano y los medios de ataque nuclear de EE.UU., incluyendo portaaviones nuclear.
					
					En el "plan de ordenamiento de la capacidad de defensa a mediano plazo", publicado recientemente por Japon, se establece que este pais invertira en los proximos 5 anos 276 mil millones de US$ en la consolidacion de la capacidad de defensa.
					
					Por otra parte, estrecha la cooperacion militar con el Sur de Corea.
					
					  En las conversaciones sostenidas el 10 de enero entre el ministro surcoreano de Defensa Nacional y su homologo japones se acordo realizar periodicamente el debate sobre la firma de convenio militar y promover la suscripcion del "convenio de asistencia de materiales belicos" y el "convenio de proteccion de informaciones militares".
					
					  Cuando sean firmados esos documentos, ambos paises podran intercambiar las informaciones militares y se estableceran entre el ejercito surcoreano y las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" de Japon la estrecha cooperacion en la asistencia de combustibles, provisiones, etc.
					
					  Despiertan la atencion los movimientos de algunos paises frente a ello.
					
					  Rusia establecio el plan de realizar en 2011 en la region del Lejano Oriente el ejercicio militar mas grande en la historia en su intento de dar destaque a su presencia militar.
					
					  China fortalece su poderio militar modernizando en los ultimos anos sus armamentos.
					
					  El cambio de la estructura militar regional se interpreta como senal de la nueva guerra fria.

articles.title: Japon se convierte en Estado belicista
articles.content:
Japon se convierte en Estado belicista
Pyongyang, 28 de enero (ATCC) -- Si bien Japon se autoproclama ante el mundo como "Estado pacifista", no lo cree la mayoria de los paises del planeta.
					Es que ese pais isleno hace muchas cosas de que son capaces solo los Estados belicistas. 
					
					Por ejemplo, a instancia de las empresas de industria belica, el gobierno japones intenta cancelar la medida de prohibir la exportacion de pertrechos belicos para dar a ellas las posibilidades de participar en la licitacion internacional y fundar la compania asociada con otros paises.
					
					Pretende incorporar a los consorcios "Mitsubishi" y "Kawasaki" al desarrollo de "F-35 Lightening-2" patrocinado por EE.UU. y otros planes de coproducciones internacionales segun tecnologias militares. 
					
					Hoy dia, los complejos industriales belicos de Japon tienen mucha influencia en el circulo politico. 
					
					En particular, los consorcios arriba mencionados conducen la conversion de Japon en una potencia militar y el expansionismo a ultramar.
					
					Los monopolios militares japoneses, que debieron ser desaparecidos completamente despues de la derrota de Japon en la Segunda Guerra Mundial, renacieron y se enriquecieron rapidamente y controlan ahora el circulo politico del pais. 
					
					Ellos pretenden incorporarse a los planes de coproducciones internacionales con el fin de aprender las tecnologias militares ultramodernas y ganar mucho dinero vendiendo a otros paises sus pertrechos de guerra. 
					
					A su vez, el gobierno japones piensa que si adquiere las tecnologias militares de EE.UU., podria desarrollar rapidamente sus fuerzas armadas sin gastar muchos fondos. 
					
					El Ministerio de Defensa de Japon se prepara ahora para la licitacion de cazas modernos a fin de comprarlos. Esto es otro objetivo del intento de cancelar la medida de prohibir la exportacion de pertrechos militares.
					
					Se dice que en esa licitacion tomaran parte la corporacion norteamericana "Lockheed Martin" con F-35 y la europea "BAE Systems" con Euro Fighter Typhoon.
					
					Japon debe tener presente que sus pretensiones de  convertirse en un Estado belicista lo llevaran a la autodestruccion.

articles.title: Aislante termico adiabatico en amplio uso
articles.content:
Aislante termico adiabatico en amplio uso
Pyongyang, 28 de enero (ATCC) -- Se usa ampliamente el nuevo aislante termico adiabatico en los organos y empresas de las ciudades de Pyongyang y Rason y otras localidades y en las aldeas rurales de Corea.
					Lo invento el colectivo de estudio de informatica de la Compania Comercial Taehung de Rason de Corea usando la fosforita como principal materia prima.
					
					Para hacerlo, no hace falta la energia ni el equipo especifico y basta con aditamentos.
					
					Si los organos y las empresas introducen el nuevo aislante en sus calderas y hornos de tratamiento termico, pueden ahorrar 30 % de carbon y elevar a 97% la tasa de combustion.
					
					Cuando las familias del campo reconstruyan sus fogones empleandolo, podran usar la turba como combustible de calefaccion y cocina y producir los fertilizantes de buena calidad.
					
					El nuevo aislante termico conviene a la proteccion medioambiental porque disminuye las emisiones de monoxido de carbono.
